verses.text: I \w said|strong="H0559"\w* in mine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, Go to \w now|strong="H3212"\w*, I will \w prove|strong="H5254"\w* thee with \w mirth|strong="H8057"\w*, therefore \w enjoy|strong="H7200"\w* \w pleasure|strong="H2896"\w*: and, behold, this also \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.
I \w said|strong="H0559"\w* of \w laughter|strong="H7814"\w*, \add It is\add* \w mad|strong="H1984"\w*: and of \w mirth|strong="H8057"\w*, \w What|strong="H2090"\w* \w doeth|strong="H6213"\w* it?

I \w sought|strong="H8446"\w* in mine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* to \w give|strong="H4900"\w* \w myself|strong="H1320"\w* unto \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, yet \w acquainting|strong="H5090"\w* mine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* with \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*; and to lay \w hold|strong="H0270"\w* on \w folly|strong="H5531"\w*, till I might \w see|strong="H7200"\w* what \add was\add* that \w good|strong="H2896"\w* for the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w*, which they should \w do|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w* \w all|strong="H4557"\w* the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of their \w life|strong="H2416"\w*.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft to give…: Heb. to draw my flesh with wine\f*\f + \fr 2.3 \ft all…: Heb. the number of the days of their life\f*
I made me \w great|strong="H1431"\w* \w works|strong="H4639"\w*; I \w builded|strong="H1129"\w* me \w houses|strong="H1004"\w*; I \w planted|strong="H5193"\w* me \w vineyards|strong="H3754"\w*:

I \w made|strong="H6213"\w* me \w gardens|strong="H1593"\w* and \w orchards|strong="H6508"\w*, and I \w planted|strong="H5193"\w* \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* in them of all \add kind of\add* \w fruits|strong="H6529"\w*:

I \w made|strong="H6213"\w* me \w pools|strong="H1295"\w* of \w water|strong="H4325"\w*, to \w water|strong="H8248"\w* therewith the \w wood|strong="H3293"\w* that bringeth \w forth|strong="H6779"\w* \w trees|strong="H6086"\w*:

I \w got|strong="H7069"\w* \add me\add* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* and \w maidens|strong="H8198"\w*, and had servants \w born|strong="H1121"\w* in my \w house|strong="H1004"\w*; also I had \w great|strong="H7235"\w* \w possessions|strong="H4735"\w* of \w great|strong="H1241"\w* and small \w cattle|strong="H6629"\w* above all that were in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me:\f + \fr 2.7 \ft servants born…: Heb. sons of my house\f*

I \w gathered|strong="H3664"\w* me also \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* and \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, and the peculiar \w treasure|strong="H5459"\w* of \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* and of the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*: I \w gat|strong="H6213"\w* me men \w singers|strong="H7891"\w* and women \w singers|strong="H7891"\w*, and the \w delights|strong="H8588"\w* of the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w men|strong="H0120"\w*, \add as\add* musical \w instruments|strong="H7705"\w*, and that of all sorts.\f + \fr 2.8 \ft musical…: Heb. musical instrument and instruments\f*

So I was \w great|strong="H1431"\w*, and \w increased|strong="H3254"\w* more than all that were \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*: also my \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \w remained|strong="H5975"\w* with me.

And whatsoever mine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \w desired|strong="H7592"\w* I \w kept|strong="H0680"\w* not from them, I \w withheld|strong="H4513"\w* not my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* from any \w joy|strong="H8057"\w*; for my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \w rejoiced|strong="H8056"\w* in all my \w labour|strong="H5999"\w*: and this was my \w portion|strong="H2506"\w* of all my \w labour|strong="H5999"\w*.

Then I \w looked|strong="H6437"\w* on all the \w works|strong="H4639"\w* that my \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* had \w wrought|strong="H6213"\w*, and on the \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* that I had \w laboured|strong="H5998"\w* to \w do|strong="H6213"\w*: and, behold, all \add was\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7469"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*, and \add there was\add* no \w profit|strong="H3504"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.

¶ And I \w turned|strong="H6437"\w* myself to \w behold|strong="H7200"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, and \w madness|strong="H1947"\w*, and \w folly|strong="H5531"\w*: for what \add can\add* the \w man|strong="H0120"\w* \add do\add* that \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*? \add even\add* that which hath been \w already|strong="H3528"\w* \w done|strong="H6213"\w*.\f + \fr 2.12 \ft even…: or, in those things which have been already done\f*

Then I \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w that|strong="H3426"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* \w excelleth|strong="H3504"\w* \w folly|strong="H5531"\w*, as far as \w light|strong="H0216"\w* \w excelleth|strong="H3504"\w* \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w*.\f + \fr 2.13 \ft that…: Heb. that there is an excellency in wisdom more than in folly, etc\f*

The wise \w man’s|strong="H2450"\w* \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* \add are\add* in his \w head|strong="H7218"\w*; but the \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* \w walketh|strong="H1980"\w* in \w darkness|strong="H2822"\w*: and I myself \w perceived|strong="H3045"\w* also that \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w event|strong="H4745"\w* \w happeneth|strong="H7136"\w* to them all.

\w Then|strong="H0227"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* I in my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, As it \w happeneth|strong="H4745"\w* to the \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*, so it \w happeneth|strong="H7136"\w* even to \w me|strong="H1571"\w*; and why was I then \w more|strong="H3148"\w* \w wise|strong="H2449"\w*? Then I \w said|strong="H1696"\w* in my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, that this also \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.\f + \fr 2.15 \ft happeneth even…: Heb. happeneth to me, even to me\f*

For \add there is\add* no \w remembrance|strong="H2146"\w* of the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* more \w than|strong="H5973"\w* of the \w fool|strong="H3684"\w* for \w ever|strong="H5769"\w*; seeing that which \w now|strong="H3528"\w* \add is\add* in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* to \w come|strong="H0935"\w* shall all be \w forgotten|strong="H7911"\w*. And how \w dieth|strong="H4191"\w* the \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add man\add*? as the \w fool|strong="H3684"\w*.

Therefore I \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* \w life|strong="H2416"\w*; because the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* that is \w wrought|strong="H6213"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* \add is\add* \w grievous|strong="H7451"\w* unto me: for all \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7469"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.

¶ Yea, I \w hated|strong="H8130"\w* all my \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* which I had \w taken|strong="H6001"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*: because I should \w leave|strong="H3240"\w* it unto the \w man|strong="H0120"\w* that shall be \w after|strong="H0310"\w* me.\f + \fr 2.18 \ft taken: Heb. laboured\f*

And who \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* whether he shall be a \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \add man\add* or a \w fool|strong="H5530"\w*? yet shall he have \w rule|strong="H7980"\w* over all my \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* wherein I have \w laboured|strong="H5998"\w*, and wherein I have shewed myself \w wise|strong="H2449"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*. This \add is\add* also \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.

Therefore I went \w about|strong="H5437"\w* to \w cause|strong="H2976"\w* my \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* to \w despair|strong="H2976"\w* of all the \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* which I \w took|strong="H5998"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*.

For there \w is|strong="H3426"\w* a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* whose \w labour|strong="H5999"\w* \add is\add* in \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, and in \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*, and in \w equity|strong="H3788"\w*; yet to a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* that hath not \w laboured|strong="H5998"\w* therein shall he \w leave|strong="H5414"\w* it \add for\add* his \w portion|strong="H2506"\w*. This also \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and a \w great|strong="H7227"\w* \w evil|strong="H7451"\w*.\f + \fr 2.21 \ft leave: Heb. give\f*

For what \w hath|strong="H1933"\w* \w man|strong="H0120"\w* of all his \w labour|strong="H5999"\w*, and of the \w vexation|strong="H7475"\w* of his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, \w wherein|strong="H1931"\w* he hath \w laboured|strong="H6001"\w* under the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w*?

For all his \w days|strong="H3117"\w* \add are\add* \w sorrows|strong="H4341"\w*, and his \w travail|strong="H6045"\w* \w grief|strong="H3708"\w*; yea, his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* taketh not \w rest|strong="H7901"\w* in the \w night|strong="H3915"\w*. This is also \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w*.

¶ \add There is\add* nothing \w better|strong="H2896"\w* for a \w man|strong="H0120"\w*, \add than\add* that he should \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* and \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*, and \add that\add* he should make his \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w enjoy|strong="H7200"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* in his \w labour|strong="H5999"\w*. \w This|strong="H2090"\w* also I \w saw|strong="H7200"\w*, that it \add was\add* from the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.\f + \fr 2.24 \ft should make…: or, delight his senses\f*
For who can \w eat|strong="H0398"\w*, or who else can \w hasten|strong="H2363"\w* \add hereunto\add*, \w more|strong="H2351"\w* than I?

For \add God\add* \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* to a \w man|strong="H0120"\w* that \add is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* in his \w sight|strong="H6440"\w* \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w*, and \w knowledge|strong="H1847"\w*, and \w joy|strong="H8057"\w*: but to the \w sinner|strong="H2398"\w* he \w giveth|strong="H5414"\w* \w travail|strong="H6045"\w*, to \w gather|strong="H0622"\w* and to heap \w up|strong="H3664"\w*, that he may \w give|strong="H5414"\w* to \add him that is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*. This also \add is\add* \w vanity|strong="H1892"\w* and \w vexation|strong="H7469"\w* of \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w*.\f + \fr 2.26 \ft in his…: Heb. before him\f*
